unnormalised: Hey folks! Scholarship portals – are they really worth the hype in the EdTech world?
normalised: Hey folks! Scholarship portals – are they really worth the hype in the EdTech world?

unnormalised: As a student who's been there, done that, (and survived engineering at IIT Delhi!), I can say they’re a mixed bag. On the one hand, they’re super convenient. Think of it like a one-stop shop for funding your dreams, especially if you're aiming for higher studies abroad, like a Masters in the US. You can filter by your course, your domicile (like if you're from UP), and even your category. No more scouring countless websites!

You can filter by your course, your domicile like if you're from U P, and even your category. No more scouring countless websites!

unnormalised: But, and this is a big BUT, be wary! Some are kinda sketchy, wanting you to pay a registration fee or something. That's a major red flag, right? Also, the sheer number of scholarships can be overwhelming. It's like trying to choose between jalebi and gulab jamun – both amazing, but you only have room for one!

unnormalised: Do your research, people! Check the legitimacy of the portal before handing over any personal information. Look for user reviews (like on Glassdoor) and see if they have a solid track record.
normalised: Do your research, people! Check the legitimacy of the portal before handing over any personal information. Look for user reviews like on Glassdoor and see if they have a solid track record.

unnormalised: Think of it like the college application process in "3 Idiots" - you need to strategize and not just blindly follow everyone else. Choose wisely, and good luck landing that scholarship! Hope you get that Rs. 10,000 monthly stipend and fulfill all your dreams of that 15 km bike ride to your favorite chai stall everyday. Also, don’t get bogged down, there's always the next time you can apply!
